title: Trump speaks on his recent shift on tariffs
shortDescription: President Donald Trump addressed his announcement of a 90-day pause on global reciprocal tariffs, but Democrats say it's due to pressure.

title: Trump pauses global reciprocal tariffs, raises China's
shortDescription: Treasury secretary Scott Bessent backed President Donald Trump's pausing of reciprocal tariffs for 90-days while raising China's levy.

title: SCOTUS allows Trump to fire labor regulators for now
shortDescription: The Supreme Court is letting Donald Trump's firing of Democratic members of independent labor boards remain in place as litigation continues.

title: Trump White House to appeal ruling lifting AP access restrictions
shortDescription: President Donald Trump's White House intends to appeal a judge's ruling lifting access restrictions on the Associated Press, which it imposed after the news agency continued referring to the Gulf of Mexico in its coverage, a court filing on Wednesday showed.

title: Trump pauses targeted tariffs for 90 days but hikes levies on China
shortDescription: Escalating the U.S. trade war with China, Trump said he was raising the tariffs for the country from 104% to 125%.

title: Judge orders Trump White House to restore access to AP
shortDescription: A U.S. judge has ordered President Donald Trump’s White House to lift access restrictions imposed on the Associated Press over the news agency's decision to continue to refer to the Gulf of Mexico in its coverage.

title: Appeals court clears way for Trump to fire federal workers
shortDescription: The ruling overturns a lower court that reinstated thousands of employees who lost their jobs in Trump's purge of the federal workforce.

title: Trump tells Americans 'BE COOL!' as China, EU hit back with tariffs
shortDescription: President Trump told Americans to "BE COOL!" and his administration downplayed the consequences as China and EU hit back with tariffs on the US.

title: Trump sued by Democrat he removed from civil rights agency
shortDescription: The former member of the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission claims her firing by President Donald Trump was illegal.

title: Trump's 'reciprocal' tariffs take effect | The Excerpt
shortDescription: Plus: Trump signs an executive order aimed at reviving the U.S. coal industry. | Health Secretary RFK Jr. is going after fluoride in tap water.

title: Trump pauses tit-for-tat tariffs for 90 days, boosts China's levy to 125%
shortDescription: China and the European Union earlier had unveiled stiff retaliation levies on the U.S. aimed at countering Trump's tariff blitz.

title: Trump administration freezes funding for Cornell, Northwestern universities
shortDescription: The Trump administration has frozen funding for Cornell and Northwestern universities while it investigates both schools over civil rights violations, a U.S. official said.

title: Trump's 'reciprocal' tariffs kick in, deepening global trade war
shortDescription: Trump's punishing tariffs have shaken a global trading order that has persisted for decades and raised fears of a recession.

title: 'Major tariff' coming soon on foreign pharmaceuticals, Trump says
shortDescription: Trump predicted a tariff on foreign pharmaceuticals will prompt drug companies to move their operations to the United States.

title: Trump signs order to revive coal industry
shortDescription: President Donald Trump is attempting to revive the long-declining coal industry with an executive order rolling back Democratic regulations.

title: Charles Koch-funded group sues Trump over 'unconstitutional' tariffs
shortDescription: A group financed by billionaire Charles Koch and conservative legal activist Leonard Leo sued Donald Trump for imposing tariffs on Chinese imports.

title: IRS agrees to share tax information to help deport migrants
shortDescription: Millions of people pay taxes with ITINs, which are used by people who don't have social security numbers and aren't legally present in the U.S.

title: Judge lifts Trump restrictions on AP over 'Gulf of Mexico'
shortDescription: A U.S. judge on Tuesday ordered President Donald Trump’s White House to lift access restrictions imposed on the Associated Press over the news agency’s decision to continue to refer to the Gulf of Mexico in its coverage.

title: Trade rep defends Trump's tariffs
shortDescription: President Donald Trump's trade representative Jamieson Greer testified in a Senate hearing, defending the president's tariffs.
